statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -4 \\ -3 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ 3 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 18 \\ 0 \\ -12 \end{array}\right] are or are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^3

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -4 \\ -3 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ 3 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 18 \\ 0 \\ -12 \end{array}\right] are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^3.
